title: UQ 2016 Student Summit
summary: You will have the opportunity to hear from members of UQ's senior executive about UQ's strategic direction and priorities for the coming year with an opportunity to ask key questions and give feedback.

venue: Terrace Room, Level 6, Sir Llew Edwards Building # 14

title: 2016 Volunteer Expo
summary: With over 45 charities and not-for-profit exhibitors attending, the UQ Volunteer Expo is the perfect event for you to find out more about volunteer organisations, available volunteering positions and the type of experience which might suit you best.
details:
8th Annual UQ Volunteer Expo

Here is the perfect event for you to find out more about volunteering!

Many employers are looking for well-rounded graduates who have more on their resume than just study. Volunteering is a great way to give back to the community, meet new people, and develop transferrable workplace skills. Itâ€™s a win-win situation!

With a variety of exhibitors, this is your chance to speak with organisations such as Woodford Folk Festival, Conservation Volunteers Australia, Multicultural Development Association and the RSPCA just to name a few! There will be puppies and free fairy floss!

Come along to explore opportunities, get experience, improve your resume and develop your community spirit!

This is a free event and all UQ students and staff are welcome to attend.  

Holt Room
UQ Union Complex
Building 21C

Wednesday 17 August 2016

10:00-1:00
venue:
Holt Room
UQ Union Complex
Building 21C

title: Employers on Campus:  Suncorp, EY & QIC
summary: Recent graduates from Suncorp, EY and QIC will provide you with insights, advice and their personal stories on how they prepared for graduation, including choosing employers, surviving the recruitment process and ultimately moving from study to work.
details:
Suncorp Group provides banking, wealth and insurance products and services across Australia and New Zealand.EY's purpose is to build a better working world through our own actions and by engaging with like-minded organisations and individuals. QIC delivers investment outcomes for its clients, created in 1991 by the Queensland government to serve its long term investment responsibilities.

Presentation:Recent graduates from Suncorp, EY and QIC will provide you with insights, advice and their personal stories on how they prepared for graduation, including choosing employers, surviving the recruitment process and ultimately moving from study to work.

Presentation Content: Transitioning from study to career - a panel of grads from Suncorp, Ernst & Young (EY) and Qld Investment Corporation (QIC) will answer your questions about applying for grad roles, starting in a new job, using your degree and career options across the Finance industry (for many disciplines). Will also include key considerations for students as they progress through their degree on what to look out for and how to prepare for a graduate position in a corporate environment.

26 July 2016 1:30 -3:30

Terrace Room, Building 14 Level 6

St. Lucia Campus

Register your attendance below.
venue:
Terrace Room, Building 14 Level 6
St. Lucia Campus

title: Employers on Campus:  Qld Dept of Environment & Heritage Protection (EHP)
summary: Come and hear about the exciting opportunities available to you through Qld Department of Environment & Heritage Protection.
details:
Want to start your career in a diverse and dynamic organisation? If so, the Greater Graduate Program offers you a unique opportunity to build your career and grow with the Queensland Government. The program provides graduates with an opportunity to work in roles within six Queensland Government departments.

Presentation Content:Graduate opportunities in the Greater Graduate Program and how to prepare your application.

title: Employers on Campus:  KordaMentha
summary: KordaMentha graduates have the opportunity to do more with their degree. The work is interesting, diverse and often complex, whether it be as part of our Restructuring, Forensic or Real estate teams.
details:
KordaMentha is an advisory and investment firm that provides Forensic, Real Estate, Turnaround and Restructuring Services. Whether our clients are looking to expand, invest, detect inappropriate behaviour or overcome under-performance within their organisation, our team of almost 350 business specialists draw upon their extensive industry and functional experience to deliver the best outcomes for stakeholders.

KordaMentha graduates have the opportunity to do more with their degree. The work is interesting, diverse and often complex, whether it be as part of our Restructuring, Forensic or Real estate teams.

Presentation Content:Overview of KordaMentha and what we do. We'll also touch on building your network.

title: Employers on Campus:  Department of Defence
summary: STEM and IT students, are you interested in a career in Intelligence? Attend a panel discussion about opportunities available for civilian Australian Public Service (APS) opportunities in the Department of Defence for graduates.
details:
Want to make a difference? Defence is seeking graduates from across all academic disciplines to take up the challenge of working for one of Australia's most dynamic organisations, with a mission of national and international significance.

Defence offers civilian staff the opportunity to play a real part in keeping Australia secure, to support intelligence operations nationally and internationally, and to support peace keeping missions overseas.

STEM and IT students, are you interested in a career in Intelligence? Attend a panel discussion about opportunities available for civilian Australian Public Service (APS) opportunities in the Department of Defence for graduates.

Presentation Content:  Experienced Graduate Managers and Defence Graduates will provide an insight into the career opportunities available and how to make your application stand out.

1:00-3:00

title: Employers on Campus:  Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)
summary: Come along to this presentation and hear what it's like to work at DFAT, both domestically and abroad, and learn about DFAT's recruitment process.
details:
The role of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade is to help make Australia stronger, safer and more prosperous by promoting and protecting our interests internationally and contributing to global stability and economic growth.

We manage a network of 96 overseas posts in five continents and we have more than 4,200 staff â€“ located in Canberra, state and territory offices and overseas posts.

The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade will present on what it is like to work at DFAT both here in Australia and overseas. DFAT will also walk students through the graduate recruitment process and answer any questions students may have.

16 August, 2016

9:00-11:00

Terrace Room, Level 6 Building 14

St. Lucia Campus

title: Employers on Campus:  LinkedPower
summary: LinkedPower will demonstrate a range of job opportunities for international students in Queensland and China including secret resume tips, effective interview techniques and successful career planning strategies.
details:
Organisation Blurb:

LinkedPower devotes itself to establishing the largest Job Website for multilingual talents in the world and a reliable partner for international firms, linking them with global markets. Equipped with the latest Internet recruiting technology and professional human resources service, LinkedPower provides efficient and precise one-stop recruitment service and quality self-managed online user experience.

Content presentation:

In this presentation the Founder of LinkedPower, and the HRD & recruitment consultant will discuss how to make the most of online resources in finding jobs and effectively utilise social networking to create job opportunities. We will demonstrate a whole range of job opportunities for international students in Queensland and China including secret resume tips, effective interview techniques and successful career planning strategies.

Topics:

  • The integration of possible resources and how to make the most of these resources in finding jobs
  • Effectively utilise social networking to achieve job opportunities
  • Welcome policies and incentives of Queensland and China to attract international students as talents
  • Demonstrate job opportunities

While presenting the above topics, real examples will be provided, resume tips, interview techniques and career planning knowledge will be addressed

Guest speaker (TBC):

Humming Lin, Bond Alumni; the Mayorâ€™s international student ambassador in Gold Coast; Chairman of the Board (Gold Coast Chinese students and scholars Association); currently working in a reputable law firm.

28 July, 2016  10:00-12:00

Terrace Room, Level 6 Building 14

St. Lucia Campus

Register your attendance below.

Terrace Room, Level 6 Building 14
St. Lucia Campus

title: Employers on Campus: College of Professional Psychology
summary: The information session is for Psychology Students and Graduates to find out more about College's psychologists' registration program. It will help them make an informed decision becoming a registered psychologist through the College Program.
details:
The College of Professional Psychology was established 20 years ago and today hundreds of our graduates are registered practicing psychologists in diverse and varied workplace roles. Our well-established programs are designed to ensure proficiency in the core capabilities and attributes required by the Psychology Board of Australia for registration as a psychologist in Australia with AHPRA.

The College of Professional Psychology Psychologists Registration Program offers a structured coursework that is practical, supportive, and flexible. It provides individual and group supervision, professional development workshops, a high level of personal and administrative support, advice on AHPRA guidelines and preparation for the PBA exam to provisional psychologists undertaking the 4+2 and 5+1 pathways.

The information session is for Psychology Students and Graduates to find out more about College's psychologists' registration program. It will help them make an informed decision becoming a registered psychologist through the College Program.

15 August, 2016

9:00-11:00

Terrace Room, Level 6 Building 14

St. Lucia Campus

Register your attendance below.
venue:
Terrace Room, Level 6 Building 14
St. Lucia Campus

title: Employers on Campus:  Hudson (legal)
summary: Hudson is a global talent solutions company with expertise in leadership and specialised recruitment, recruitment process outsourcing, talent managment and contracting solutions.  Come along to this presentation to hear about the legal market in QLD and how to differentiate yourself from others.
details:
Hudson is a global talent solutions company with expertise in leadership and specialised recruitment, recruitment process outsourcing, talent managment and contracting solutions.  We combine broad geographic presence, world-class talent solutions and a tailored, consultative approach to help businesses and professional achieve higher performance and outstanding results.  

Our team of dedicated legal consultants has earned the respect of their legal clients from a range of industry sectors including banking and finance, construction, consumer, mining and oil and gas. We have strong relationships with many top Australian and international law firms. Hudson is also a preferred service provider to a wide range of federal, state and local government authorities, as well as statutory bodies, government corporations and non-profit organisations.

Presentation Content:  We will cover the legal market today, what employers are looking for & having resilience and being proactive as well as the complexities of the current legal employment market and what students can do to differentiate themselves from other candidates. We will also discuss how to proactively and physically market yourself at the initial and interview stages.

Thursday 28 July 2016
1:00-2:00

Level 6, Building 14
St. Lucia Campus
